Package com.lucaf.robotic_core.dhRobotics.rgi100

Class RGI100

java.lang.Object
com.lucaf.robotic_core.impl.MotorInterface
com.lucaf.robotic_core.dhRobotics.rgi100.RGI100
public class RGI100 extends MotorInterface
Class that manages the RGI100_22 device (Gripper and Rotation)

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class com.lucaf.robotic_core.impl.MotorInterface

    hasError, isInitialized, isMoving, isShutdown, isStopped

    Constructors
    Constructor

    RGI100(RegisterInterface registerInterface)
    Convenience constructor that creates an empty state map and no callback.

    Convenience constructor that accepts an existing state map but no callback.
    RGI100(RegisterInterface registerInterface, HashMap<String,Object> state, State notifyStateChange)
    Constructor that initializes the RGI100_22 object with an existing RS485 connection and optional external state map and state callback.

  • Constructor Details

    • RGI100

      public RGI100(RegisterInterface registerInterface, HashMap<String,Object> state, State notifyStateChange)
      Constructor that initializes the RGI100_22 object with an existing RS485 connection and optional external state map and state callback.
      Parameters:
      registerInterface - the low-level register/communication interface used to talk with the device
      state - a shared state map that will be updated by this class (may be null or empty)
      notifyStateChange - optional State instance used to receive callbacks when state changes or errors occur

    • RGI100

      public RGI100(RegisterInterface registerInterface, HashMap<String,Object> state)
      Convenience constructor that accepts an existing state map but no callback.
      Parameters:
      registerInterface - the communication interface
      state - the state map to use

    • RGI100

      public RGI100(RegisterInterface registerInterface)
      Convenience constructor that creates an empty state map and no callback.
      Parameters:
      registerInterface - the communication interface

  • Method Details

    • applyConfig

      public void applyConfig(RGI100Config config) throws IOException
      Applies the provided configuration to the device by setting grip and rotation speed and force parameters.
      Parameters:
      config - the RGI100Config instance containing desired parameters
      Throws:
      IOException - if communication with the device fails while setting parameters

    • applyTravelParameters

      public void applyTravelParameters(GripParameters parameters) throws IOException
      Applies the provided grip parameters to the device by setting grip and rotation speed and force.
      Parameters:
      parameters - the GripParameters instance containing desired parameters
      Throws:
      IOException - if communication with the device fails while setting parameters

    • stop

      public void stop() throws IOException
      Stops device movement and signals the hardware to stop. This method will also update internal state flags.
      Overrides:
      stop in class MotorInterface
      Throws:
      IOException - if communication with the device fails while sending the stop command

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown() throws IOException
      Performs a graceful shutdown of internal executors and stops the device. This attempts to stop periodic polling and cancels queued tasks.
      Overrides:
      shutdown in class MotorInterface
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while stopping the device

    • hasGripInitialized

      public boolean hasGripInitialized() throws IOException
      Checks whether the grip subsystem completed its initialization routine on the device.
      Returns:
      true if the grip reports initialization complete; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is a communication error while reading the feedback register

    • hasRotationInitialized

      public boolean hasRotationInitialized() throws IOException
      Checks whether the rotation subsystem completed its initialization routine on the device.
      Returns:
      true if the rotation reports initialization complete; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is a communication error while reading the feedback register

    • initialize

      public Future<Boolean> initialize() throws RejectedExecutionException
      Starts both grip and rotation initialization on the device and waits asynchronously until both subsystems report ready.
      Overrides:
      initialize in class MotorInterface
      Returns:
      a Future completed with true if initialization succeeded, false otherwise
      Throws:
      RejectedExecutionException

    • moveToAbsoluteAngle

      public void moveToAbsoluteAngle(long angle) throws IOException
      Move the rotator to an absolute angle value.
      Parameters:
      angle - absolute angle target (device-specific units)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the device is not initialized or communication fails

    • moveToRelativeAngle

      public void moveToRelativeAngle(int angle) throws IOException
      Move the rotator by a relative offset from its current position.
      Parameters:
      angle - relative angle offset (positive or negative), device-specific units
      Throws:
      IOException - if the device is not initialized or communication fails

    • isRotationMoving

      public PositionFeedback isRotationMoving() throws IOException
      Reads the rotation movement feedback register and translates it to a PositionFeedback.
      Returns:
      the current rotation feedback state
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the feedback register fails

    • isGripMoving

      public PositionFeedback isGripMoving() throws IOException
      Reads the grip movement feedback register and translates it to a PositionFeedback.
      Returns:
      the current grip feedback state
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the feedback register fails

    • getGripPosition

      public int getGripPosition() throws IOException
      Returns the current raw grip position read from the device.
      Returns:
      grip position (0..1000), or device-specific sentinel values if reported by hardware
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the register fails

    • waitEndPosition

      public PositionFeedback waitEndPosition(long timeout) throws IOException
      Blocks the calling thread until the rotator reaches its target or an error/blocked state occurs. This method periodically polls the device and will throw an IOException when the device reports that it stopped moving unexpectedly or when a hardware fault has been detected.
      Parameters:
      timeout - maximum time to wait in milliseconds (negative value means infinite)
      Returns:
      the final PositionFeedback state (REACHED or BLOCKED)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the device is not moving, a fault occurred, or communication fails

    • waitEndPosition

      public PositionFeedback waitEndPosition() throws IOException
      Blocks the calling thread until the rotator reaches its target or an error/blocked state occurs. This method periodically polls the device and will throw an IOException when the device reports that it stopped moving unexpectedly or when a hardware fault has been detected.
      Returns:
      the final PositionFeedback state (REACHED or BLOCKED)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the device is not moving, a fault occurred, or communication fails

    • waitEndGrip

      public PositionFeedback waitEndGrip(long timeout) throws IOException
      Blocks the calling thread until the grip movement completes. This method polls the hardware and will throw a DeviceCommunicationException when the device stops unexpectedly or a fault is detected.
      Parameters:
      timeout - maximum time to wait in milliseconds (negative value means infinite)
      Returns:
      the final PositionFeedback state (REACHED_WITH_OBJ, REACHED_WITHOUT_OBJ or FALL)
      Throws:
      IOException - if a low-level I/O error occurs while communicating with the device
      DeviceCommunicationException - if the device reports it is not moving or a fault occurred

    • waitEndGrip

      public PositionFeedback waitEndGrip() throws IOException
      Blocks the calling thread until the grip movement completes. This method polls the hardware and will throw a DeviceCommunicationException when the device stops unexpectedly or a fault is detected.
      Returns:
      the final PositionFeedback state (REACHED_WITH_OBJ, REACHED_WITHOUT_OBJ or FALL)
      Throws:
      IOException - if a low-level I/O error occurs while communicating with the device
      DeviceCommunicationException - if the device reports it is not moving or a fault occurred

    • moveToRelativeAngleAndWait

      public Future<Pair<Boolean,PositionFeedback>> moveToRelativeAngleAndWait(int angle)
      Moves the rotator by a relative angle and waits for completion asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      angle - relative angle offset (device-specific units)
      Returns:
      a Future containing a Pair where the first element indicates success, and the second the final feedback state

    • moveToAbsoluteAngleAndWait

      public Future<Pair<Boolean,PositionFeedback>> moveToAbsoluteAngleAndWait(int angle)
      Moves the rotator to an absolute angle and waits for completion asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      angle - absolute target angle (device-specific units)
      Returns:
      a Future containing a Pair where the first element indicates success, and the second the final feedback state

    • setGripPosition

      public void setGripPosition(int position) throws IOException
      Sets the grip target position. Accepted range is clamped to [0, 1000].
      Parameters:
      position - target grip position (0 = fully open, 1000 = fully closed; device-specific mapping)
      Throws:
      IOException - if the device is not initialized or writing the register fails

    • setGripPositionAndWait

      public Future<Pair<Boolean,PositionFeedback>> setGripPositionAndWait(int position)
      Sets the grip target position and waits for movement completion asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      position - target grip position (0..1000)
      Returns:
      a Future containing a Pair where the first element indicates success, and the second the final feedback state

    • getGripForce

      public int getGripForce() throws IOException
      Reads the configured grip force percentage from the device.
      Returns:
      grip force value in the range 0..100
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the register fails

    • setGripForce

      public void setGripForce(int force) throws IOException
      Sets the grip force percentage. Values are clamped to the range 0..100.
      Parameters:
      force - desired grip force (0..100)
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing the register fails

      Throws:
      IOException - if writing the register fails

      Returns:
      true if the write succeeded, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing the register fails

    • saveConfig

      public boolean saveConfig(boolean defaults) throws IOException
      Persists the current configuration into device non-volatile memory. Note: some transient parameters (speed, force, position) may not be preserved on power-cycle depending on device firmware.
      Parameters:
      defaults - if true, restore factory defaults; if false, save current configuration
      Returns:
      true if the operation was accepted by the device, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing the register fails

    • saveConfig

      public boolean saveConfig() throws IOException
      Persists the current configuration into device non-volatile memory (no defaults).
      Returns:
      true if the operation was accepted by the device, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if writing the register fails

    • getErrorFlags

      public ErrorFlags getErrorFlags() throws IOException
      Reads and returns the device error flags wrapper.
      Returns:
      an ErrorFlags instance representing current device errors
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading the error register fails

    • clearError

      public void clearError() throws IOException
      Clears the device error state. Implementation is currently not provided; this method logs a warning.
      Throws:
      IOException - if clearing errors requires I/O and fails (not implemented)
